properties.headline: Tri Nations Rugby - Saturday 5 December - PARRAMATTA O'Connell St at Victoria Rd
properties.publicTransport: Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
Tri-Nations Rugby: Australia v Argentina at Bankwest Stadium from 7:45pm until 9:30pm approx.

Traffic may be heavier than usual on O'Connell St, Parramatta Rd, Church St, Victoria Rd and James Ruse Dr as fans travel to the stadium. Motorists should plan to arrive early and allow extra travel time.

Roads around the stadium will close from 9:30pm until 10:30pm approx. Roads will reopen once crowds have safely cleared the precinct. The following closures will be in place:

  • O’Connell St from Grose St to George St
  • Ross St from O’Connell St to Trott St
  • Victoria Rd from O’Connell St to Villiers St

Motorists are advised to allow extra travel time and detour around the closures via Grose St, Brickfield St, Victoria Rd and Wilde Ave in both directions.

properties.headline: Concert - Saturday 5 December - SYDNEY OLYMPIC PARK M4 Mwy, Homebush Bay Dr, Parramatta Rd, Centenary Dr approaching Qudos Bank Arena
properties.publicTransport: Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
Greatest Southern Nights - Bernard Fanning and Matt Corby concert at Qudos Bank Arena from 7:50pm to approx 10:30pm. 

Traffic may be heavier than on roads approaching Olympic Park on Saturday evening as fans travel to the concert. Local roads in the precinct will also close from 4:30pm to accommodate the event. 

Motorists should allow extra travel time on the M4 Mwy, Homebush Bay Dr, Concord Rd, Lane Cove Rd, Parramatta Rd, Centenary Dr and Silverwater Rd.

Traffic is expected to be heavier than usual on Anzac Pde, Eastern Distributor, Moore Park Rd, Cleveland St and Lang Rd approaching Moore Park as cricket fans travel to the match on Sunday afternoon. 

Driver Ave will be partially closed from 4pm and will reopen once crowds have safely cleared the precinct. 

Special event clearways are in effect on various roads around Moore Park from 3pm until 12am midnight including sections of Moore Park Rd, Albion St, Lang Rd, Chalmers St, Fitzroy St, Flinders St and Foveaux St.

Clearways are strict no-parking zones even for local residents and RMS Mobility Scheme Permit holders. Check signs carefully as vehicles left in clearways will be towed and a fee applies.

properties.headline: Touch Football Gala Day - Sunday 13 December - TUGGERAH Bryant Dr, Lake Rd approaching Central Coast Regional Sporting & Recreation Complex
properties.publicTransport: Plan your trip at transportnsw.info.

Over 1,500 people throughout the day are expected to attend the Hornets Juniors Touch Football Gala Day at the Central Coast Regional Sporting & Recreation Complex in Tuggerah from 7am to 7pm on Sunday. 

Traffic is expected to be heavier than usual along Bryant Dr and Lake Rd as attendees travel to and from the venue.

Motorists should allow extra travel time and be aware of increased pedestrian activity on local roads.
properties.displayName: Touch Football Gala Day - Sunday 13 December

properties.headline: Bondi2Berry cycle - Saturday 5 December - BONDI BEACH TO BERRY via General Holmes Dr, Grand Pde, Kingsway, Princes Hwy, Lawrence Hargrave Drive
properties.otherAdvice:
Up to 120 cyclists will take part in The Ride to Remember bike ride travelling from Bondi Beach at 6am to Berry on the NSW South Coast by 2:30pm.

Road or lane closures will not be in place however motorists should exercise caution as they share roads with cyclists during the event.

The group will leave Bondi at 6:15am and travel via roads including Bondi Rd, Darley Rd, South Dowling St, General Holmes Dr, Grand Pde, Rocky Point Rd, Taren Point Rd, The Kingsway and the Princes Hwy through the Royal National Park to Stanwell Tops.

From there, they will travel along the coast via Otford Rd, Lawrence Hargrave Dr, Grand Pacific Dr and Squires Way into Wollongong. From there, they will travel via Windang Rd and the Princes Hwy to Kiama before their last leg to Berry via Crooked River Rd, Beach Rd and Queen St. The last wave of cyclists will arrive in Berry by 2:30pm.

Traffic may be busier than usual around the ride particularly as they travel along Lawrence Hargrave Drive from Stanwell Park to Thirroul, then the Princes Hwy from Bulli Pass to Bulli during the already busy weekend traffic. 

Motorists are also reminded when overtaking cyclists to leave a 1.5m distance on roads with speed limits over 60km/h and a 1m distance on roads 60km/h or under.

roads.mainStreet: via General Holmes Dr, Grand Pde, Kingsway, Princes Hwy, Lawrence Hargrave Drive

Traffic may be heavier than usual on O'Connell St, Parramatta Rd, Church St, Victoria Rd and James Ruse Dr as fans travel to the stadium during Wednesday evening peak. Fans should plan to arrive early and allow extra travel time.

The following roads around the stadium will close from 10pm until 11pm approx and will reopen once crowds have safely cleared the precinct:

properties.headline: Musical opening night - Thursday 10 December - HAYMARKET Pitt St and Campbell St at Capitol Theatre
properties.publicTransport: Plan your trip at transportnsw.info.

arrangementAttachments.displayName: Frozen the Musical Special Event Clearways
arrangementAttachments.linkName: Frozen the Musical Special Event Clearways

properties.otherAdvice:
More than 1,500 people are expected to attend the opening night of Frozen the Musical at Capitol Theatre on Thursday evening from 6pm. 

Motorists in the area should allow extra travel time and be aware of increased pedestrian activity.

From 2pm Thursday until 1am Friday lane closures will be in place on Campbell St between Pitt St and George St. Campbell St will become 2-way during the closure. The parking lane on Pitt St between Hay St and Campbell St will also be closed. 

The footpath on the southern side of Campbell St between Pitt St and George St will be closed during this time. 

Special event clearways will also be in effect from 2pm Thursday until 1am Friday on both sides of Campbell St between Pitt St and George St and from 2pm until 9pm on Thursday on the western side of Pitt St between Hay St and Campbell St. 

Clearways are strict no-parking zones, even for local residents or RMS Mobility Scheme Permit holders. Vehicles left in clearways will be towed and a fee applies. If your vehicle is towed, call 132 701 to find its new location.

properties.headline: Christmas Fair - Sunday 6 December - MOUNT PENANG Central Coast Hwy approaching Mount Penang Gardens
properties.otherAdvice:
The 2020 Mount Penang Christmas Fair will be taking place at Mount Penang Gardens on Sunday from 9am until 2pm. 

Traffic in the area is expected to be heavier than usual, particularly off the Central Coast Hwy at Kangaoo Rd and The Avenue intersections as attendees travel to and from the event site.

Motorists should allow extra travel time and be aware of increased pedestrian activity on roads in the area.

properties.headline: NYE in North Sydney - Thursday 31 December - NORTH SYDNEY, MCMAHONS POINT, KIRRIBILLI, WAVERTON various roads
properties.publicTransport: Due to road closures buses will use stops on Pacific Hwy / Miller St from 7pm, some buses may stop running earlier in the day. From 11pm buses will terminate at North Sydney while the Harbour Bridge is closed. Plan your trip at transportnsw.info.

arrangementAttachments.displayName: NYE 2020 North Sydney & surrounds - Road Closure & Clearways Map
arrangementAttachments.linkName: NYE 2020 North Sydney & surrounds - Road Closure & Clearways Map

properties.otherAdvice:
Road closures and special event clearways will be in place throughout parts of North Sydney Council areas including McMahons Point, Lavender Bay, Milsons Point, Kirribilli, Cremorne Point and Kurraba Point to allow everyone to move around safely and practise physical distancing. Most roads in these areas remain closed until 3am on New Year's Day

Please note that access to some venues around Sydney Harbour in the city are restricted to NYE passholders only. Visit nsw.gov.au/nye for details.

Key road closure times

From 3pm: Olympic Drive in Kirribilli will be closed until 3am.

From 5pm: The Cahill Expressway and the High St and Mount St on-ramps will be closed until 6am. In McMahons Point and Lavender Bay, Blues Point Road and Lavender Crescent at the waterfront will be closed until 3am. In Cremorne Point and Kurraba Point sections of Kurraba Road, Baden Road and Milsons Road near the waterfront will be closed until 3am - access will be maintained for local residents between 5pm and 7pm.

From 7pm: various roads around North Sydney Station and in McMahons Point, Milsons Point and Kirribilli will be closed until 3am. Note that Lavender Street and Union Road, and roads in Waverton remain open this year.

From 11pm: the Sydney Harbour Bridge will be closed in both directions until 1.30am.  

Special event clearways will be in effect on various local roads in these areas as well as major roads including Miller St, Falcon St and Military Rd from 3pm New Year’s Eve until 3am New Year’s Day.

Clearways are strict no-parking zones and apply even if you have a local resident parking permit or Mobility Scheme Parking permit. Please check signs carefully as vehicles left in clearways will be towed and a fee applies. If your vehicle is towed call 132 701 to find its new location.

arrangementElements.html:
The Spit Bridge will operate to a regular weekday timetable with additional openings on New Year's Eve. 

The bridge will open at the following times. (Note: + are the additional opening times):

  • Thursday 31 December 2020: 10:15am   11:15am   1:15pm   2:15pm   3:30pm*+   7:30pm*+   8:15pm   9:15pm   10:45pm*+    
  • Friday 1 January 2021: 2:15am*+   3:15am+   8:30am   10:00am   11:30am   2:30pm   4:30pm   6:30pm   8:30pm   9:30pm

* NSW Water Police in attendance at Spit Bridge to assist with openings

+ Additional opening times
arrangementElements.title: Spit Bridge opening times

Special event clearways are strict no-parking zones for all vehicle types, and apply even to local residents or RMS Mobility Scheme Permit holders. Check signs carefully as vehicles left in clearways will be towed and a fee applies. If your vehicle is towed call 132 701 to find its new location.

Clearways are in place on both sides of the road unless stated otherwise.

properties.headline: NYE in the Sydney CBD - Thursday 31 December - SYDNEY CBD, CIRCULAR QUAY, THE ROCKS roads north of Market St
properties.publicTransport: From 5pm, buses in Circular Quay will relocate to Martin Place, from 7pm most buses will operate from temporary terminals at Hyde Park, Town Hall and Wynyard. Plan your trip at transportnsw.info.

arrangementAttachments.displayName: Sydney CBD NYE - Road Closures & Clearways Map
arrangementAttachments.linkName: Sydney CBD NYE - Road Closures & Clearways Map

properties.otherAdvice:
Roads in the city will start to close from 2pm this New Year's Eve to allow everyone to move around the Sydney CBD safely and practise physical distancing. Most roads remain closed until 4am on New Year's Day. 

Please note that access to some venues around Sydney Harbour in the city are restricted to NYE passholders only. Visit nsw.gov.au/nye for details.

Key road closure timings

  • From 2pm: roads in Circular Quay and The Rocks including sections of George St, Hickson Rd, Young St, Phillip St and Macquarie St* will be closed. * Access to Macquarie St will be maintained for residents/guests until 5pm.
  • From 4pm: roads in The Rocks including sections of Cumberland St, Harrington St, Gloucester St and Argyle St will be closed.
  • From 5pm: The Cahill Expressway and roads in Circular Quay including Pitt St, Alfred St and Loftus St will be closed.
  • From 7pm: sections of Grosvenor St, Bridge St, Macquarie St and College St will be closed.
  • From 10pm: roads around Wynyard including sections of York St, Clarence St, King St, Margaret St, Erskine St and other nearby roads will be closed.
  • From 11pm: the Sydney Harbour Bridge will be closed in both directions and the eastbound lanes of the Anzac Bridge will also be closed until 1.30am.

Most roads will reopen by 4am on New Year’s Day 1 January once infrastructure is safely removed from the roadway. The Harbour Bridge and Anzac Bridge will reopen by 1.30am, while the Cahill Expressway lanes 7 + 8 and eastbound lanes of the Circular Quay Overpass will remain closed until 6am on New Year’s Day.

Special event clearways will be in effect in the city on roads in Circular Quay and The Rocks from 12pm midday on New Year’s Eve 31 December until 4am on New Year’s Day 1 January. On various roads from Bridge St to Goulburn St in the city’s south, clearways will be in effect from 3pm on New Year’s Eve 31 December until 4am on New Year’s Day 1 January.

Clearways are strict no-parking zones, even for local residents or RMS Mobility Scheme Permit holders. Vehicles left in clearways will be towed and a fee applies. If your vehicle is towed call 132 701 to find its new location.

arrangementElements.html:

arrangementElements.title: Road Closures

arrangementElements.html:
Special event clearways are strict no-parking zones, even for local residents or RMS Mobility Scheme Permit holders. Vehicles left in clearways will be towed and a fee applies. If your vehicle is towed call 132 701 to find its new location.                                                     

CIRCULAR QUAY / THE ROCKS
